name: Enable AWS GuardDuty in all AWS regions
description: Ensure that AWS GuardDuty is enabled in all AWS regions to provide continuous monitoring for malicious or unauthorized behavior across the AWS environment.

name: Enable GuardDuty Malware Protection for EC2 instances
description: Enable GuardDuty Malware Protection for EC2 to detect potential malware by scanning Amazon EBS volumes attached to EC2 instances and container workloads.

name: Enable GuardDuty S3 Protection
description: Ensure GuardDuty S3 Protection is enabled to monitor and detect potential security threats related to S3 bucket activity.

name: Enable GuardDuty RDS Protection
description: Enable GuardDuty RDS Protection to monitor and detect potential security threats related to Amazon RDS database activity.

name: Enable GuardDuty EKS Audit Log Monitoring
description: Enable GuardDuty EKS Audit Log Monitoring to detect potential security threats in Amazon EKS cluster activity.

name: Enable GuardDuty Lambda Protection
description: Enable GuardDuty Lambda Protection to monitor and identify potential security threats when AWS Lambda functions are invoked.

name: Implement centralized management for GuardDuty
description: Configure GuardDuty to be centrally managed across all AWS accounts in the organization using AWS Organizations or delegated administrator account.

name: Configure automated response for high severity GuardDuty findings
description: Implement automated response mechanisms, such as AWS EventBridge rules and AWS Lambda functions, to take immediate action on high severity GuardDuty findings.

name: Enable GuardDuty findings export to S3
description: Configure GuardDuty to automatically export findings to a designated S3 bucket for long-term storage, analysis, and integration with other security tools.

name: Implement GuardDuty suppression rules
description: Create and maintain GuardDuty suppression rules to reduce noise from known false positive findings, allowing security teams to focus on actual threats.

name: Configure GuardDuty custom threat lists
description: Implement custom threat lists in GuardDuty to enhance detection capabilities based on organization-specific threat intelligence and known malicious IP addresses or domains.

name: Enable GuardDuty integration with Security Hub
description: Configure GuardDuty to send findings to AWS Security Hub for centralized visibility and correlation with other security findings across the AWS environment.

name: Implement regular review process for GuardDuty findings
description: Establish a process for regular review and triage of GuardDuty findings, including assigning ownership, setting resolution timeframes, and tracking remediation actions.

name: Configure GuardDuty notifications
description: Set up GuardDuty notifications using Amazon SNS to alert security teams of new high-severity findings or other critical security events detected by GuardDuty.
